meanings.sent1: The cute puppy had a nosed face.
meanings.sent2: She admired the nosed features of the statue.
meanings.sent3: The clown's nosed antics made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her keen sense of smell nosed out the hidden treats.
meanings.sent5: The nosed character in the story could smell danger from afar.

meanings.definition: Having a specified kind of nose
meanings.sent1: The long-nosed elephant was a sight to see.
meanings.sent2: He preferred the short-nosed cars for their speed.
meanings.sent3: The nosed mask at the party was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp-nosed intuition saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The nosed detective could sniff out the truth in any case.

meanings.definition: Having a nose of a specified kind
meanings.sent1: The snub-nosed airplane was perfect for short flights.
meanings.sent2: The wide-nosed glasses suited his face well.
meanings.sent3: The nosed costume at the play was a hit with the audience.
meanings.sent4: His keen-nosed sense of direction never failed him.
meanings.sent5: The nosed character in the movie had a unique charm.

meanings.sent1: The red-nosed reindeer led the way through the snow.
meanings.sent2: She loved the pink-nosed teddy bear she got as a gift.
meanings.sent3: The nosed cake at the party was a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent4: His cold-nosed touch sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The nosed protagonist in the book had a distinct personality.
